author: treyzania
content: This is kind of a bad explanation actually,  what was unique about it is that the identity precompile returned the output as a slice into the contract's current memory instead of a buffer created elsewhere

author: treyzania
content: and that slice was supposed to be kept unchanging so that returncodecopy could work, but since it referenced its own memory if the memory changed it would corrupt returnData
